headline: Tomato Watermelon Salad
description: This watermelon tomato salad with sweet onion, feta cheese, and fresh mint is a delicious and refreshing combination of summertime flavors.
name: Tomato Watermelon Salad
recipeIngredient: 1 large seedless watermelon, cut into 1-inch cubes
1 pinch coarse salt, or to taste
1 pinch ground black pepper, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Gently mix watermelon, tomatoes, feta cheese, onion, and mint in a large bowl.
Whisk olive oil, vinegar, salt, and pepper together in a small bowl; drizzle over salad and gently toss to coat.

review.reviewBody: This was outstanding! I did make a few substitutions because of what I had on hand. I subbed the feta for goat cheese and used an apricot White balsamic vinegar. This will be my go to summer salad.
Awesome salad! This is a keeper! Letting it rest in the fridge for several hours will make it meld and taste even better!
Awesome salad! This is a keeper! Letting it rest in the fridge for several hours will make it meld and taste even better!
Delicious! I just added more mint and used cherry tomatoes.
This is a new family fav! Everyone liked it and asked for seconds or the recipe. I did make one small change. I swapped out fresh Thai basil for the mint.
Great combination! I used green onions, rather than a sweet onion. Did not have mint on hand, but I imagine that would make it even better!
Made a smaller amount for two, and we ate it all! The only change was dark balsamic vinegar--not as pretty, but as good.
Super tasty! I used fresh basil and a pinch of dried mint leaves.
I used lemon cucumber vinegar; it was delicious and well-received by our guests. Definitely will make again!
This is always a hit when I take it to cookouts! “It’s refreshing and flavorful” is typically what I hear after people hesitantly take a bite. Love this recipe!

Great summertime salad when using fresh garden tomato and watermelon. I used both chocolate mint and spear mint and doubled the mint in recipe. Next time I think I'll try some kind of fruit vinaigrette.
Delicious I had some celery and radishes left in my refrigerator, I chopped them and added them to the salad for extra crunch
Delicious I had some celery and radishes left in my refrigerator, I chopped them and added them to the salad for extra crunch

I made it for a party and only made it a few minutes before. It was very watery. Everyone enjoyed it, but I wasn't happy with the excess water and look of it. I hope to try it again with better results!!

I brought it to a party, great reviews! Surprisingly people are still apprehensive of watermelon salad, but word spread. I'm going to add more mint. I'd also like to know how to keep it from getting too watery in the bowl!

Just made it again and I could eat the whole bowl! I added extra mint and extra white balsamic vinegar to kick up the flavor just a bit more. My watermelon wasn't the sweetest I've ever bought but it doesn't really matter in this recipe
Delicious! Perfect light salad for summer. I added a bit more onion and mint than the recipe called for extra flavor, but other than that stick to the plan and this came out great.

This is so yummy and refreshing. As suggested by another, I used the Trader Joe's champagne vinegar. Great for summer potlucks, as it does not have to be refrigerated. I also tried it with goat cheese instead of feta and that was delicious as well.
This recipe is the quintessential summer dish! Love it. Everyone who tries it feels the same. Thanks!

What an interesting combination of flavours! I made this a few times last summer when the tomatoes were fresh from the garden....I can't imagine eating this any other way! Thanks for this amazing recijpe!!
Only thing I did different was I used a purchased balsamic vinaigrette. I thought this salad was okay, but my husband liked it quite a lot.
I absolutely love this. Make exactly as written. A keeper for sure!
Interesting blend of flavors. Easy to prepare.
I loved the flavors of this salad. Very refreshing.
Very refreshing! Serve chilled. I prefer it with more mint as well.

I was not sure about he watermeon and feta combination .
it is great ! wish I done it before.
Very refreshing and colorfu, perfect for summer time. Thank you for the recipe
Unbelievable combination of creative tastes and colors! I am going to try it again with cucumber and green & red peppers added.

So I made this yesterday, and I'm completely addicted to it!! I had been looking for more fruit/veggie salad recipes for easy quick family snacks to keep on hand and this is my new favorite!! I had to modify the recipe because I cannot eat feta because I'm pregnant so I cubed provolone, I couldn't find white balsamic so I used regular and the grocery store was out of mint so I had to omit it. Also, I just tossed the ingredients together and then stirred but I recommend whisking as suggested so you dont break up the fruit. I also dumped all the watermelon juice into the mix. The dressing is so wonderful and delicious, we added some cold cooked pasta just because the juice/dressing is too amazing to waste. My husband was skeptical, but I knew it would be great since I had seen similar salads while I was stationed in Sicily and this recipe did NOT disappoint! THANKS SO MUCH for posting this recipe- its my new family favorite
I really loved this salad. I made for my husband, didn't warn him, he loved the surprise of the watermelon. It was so refreshing! The favors held for each ingredient.
This was great with fresh tomatoes. Perfect accompaniment to grilled pork chops. I also omitted the mint and used 3/4c blue cheese instead of feta since I didn't have any.
I skip the mint and use red wine vinegar instead of white basalmic
Wow!! So glad I tried this! All of the flavors go very nicely. Fresh and light salad for snacking or to make for get togethers!
I did change it a bit because I didn't have any mint or feta on hand. I also added some chopped cucumber. Love these flavors!
I was hesitant but wow am I glad I tried this. I will be taking this to picnics for many summers to come. Try it. You won't be disappointed.

I tasted after mixing up this salad, and then added more vinegar, but otherwise, followed the directions. I was out of white balsamic, so I used Trader Joe's orange muscat champagne vinegar which gave it a nice zing. For my own taste preference, I will add more mint the next time, but this is a nice and refreshing watermelon-tomato salad.
Awesome salad! I use grape tomatoes. Used goat cheese because I had it on hand and it was wonderful. I am definitely making it again. Thanks for the great recipe.
We both like this unusual salad but it must be made with cherry tomatoes or grape tomatoes.

I love, love, love this recipe! You might not think it but the sweet of the watermelon pairs so well with the tomatoes. I used fresh tomatoes right from my garden and it was like a little taste of summer. I will definitely make this recipe again.
